pageContext.claim: “[The Chinese] are going to buy $250 billion worth of product and by the way they are doing okay but the ink wasn't dry on that deal when the -- when the plague floated in.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often says China committed to buy $250 billion in goods from the United States as part of his trade deal, but the figure is $200 billion over two years compared to a 2017 baseline. That $200 billion figure includes the purchase of farm products, which Trump incorrectly hypes as $50 billion -- it's $32 billion -- so Trump is mistakenly combining the two numbers. The Chinese have indicated these are aspirational numbers, not written in stone as Trump implies, and certainly the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on buying patterns is unclear.
